danfulea.phys

Class PhysUtilities

  • java.lang.Object
    • danfulea.phys.PhysUtilities

  • public class PhysUtilities
extends java.lang.Object
    Several physics utilities including BATEMAN decay law.
    Author:
    Dan Fulea, 04 JUL 2006.

      static double gammaAbsorbedDose(double photonEnergy, double yield, double sourceActivity, double calculationPointDistance, double massEnergyAbsCoeff, double exposureTime)
      Given photon energy in MeV, its yield (probability of emission) as a number less or equal to 1, the source activity in Bq which emits those photons, the mass-energy absorbtion coefficient in cm^2/g taken from literature (or by other means), the distance from the radioactive source in cm and the exposure time in seconds at that location, this routine returns the dose due to absorbtion of gamma radiation at that distance in microGy.
      static double gammaAbsorbedDoseDebit(double photonEnergy, double yield, double sourceActivity, double calculationPointDistance, double massEnergyAbsCoeff)
      Given photon energy in MeV, its yield (probability of emission) as a number less or equal to 1, the source activity in Bq which emits those photons, the mass-energy absorbtion coefficient in cm^2/g taken from literature (or by other means) and the distance from the radioactive source in cm, this routine returns the dose debit due to absorbtion of gamma radiation at that distance in microGy/hour.
      static double gammaRadDose(double yield, double gammaEnergy, double calcPointDistance, double gammaMassEnergyAbsCoeff, double gammaLinAttCoeff, double volActivity, double exposureTime)
      Compute dose at a target point P surrounded by a radioactive medium.

      static double xTubeAirKermaAtExit(double voltage, double zAnode, double mA, double exposureTime, double gammaMassAbsAirCoeff, double filtration, double absorbantDist)
      Given an XRay tube voltage in kV, current in mA, Z for anode, exposure time in seconds, mass-energy absorbtion coefficient in air (cm^2/g) at average photon energy in spectrum, the tube total filtration in mmAl and the distance in cm, this routine returns the kerma in air at that distance in microGy.

      • decayLaw

        public static double decayLaw(double a0,
                              double t12_sec,
                              int d0,
                              int m0,
                              int y0,
                              int d,
                              int m,
                              int y)
        Return the final nuclide activity based on its initial activity a0 computed at day d0 (1-31), month m0 (1-12), year y0 and nuclide half-life in seconds t12_sec. The final activity is computed at day d, month m and year y.
        Parameters:
        a0 - a0
        t12_sec - t12_sec
        d0 - d0
        m0 - m0
        y0 - y0
        d - d
        m - m
        y - y
        Returns:
        the result

      • computeDecayConstant

        public static double[] computeDecayConstant(double[] t)
        Prerequisite to Bateman. It computes the decay constant for a given (array of) half-life. LAMBDA = Ln(2)/HalfLife
        Parameters:
        t - nuclide half life array
        Returns:
        the result

        Parameters:
        t - nuclide half life array
        b - nuclide branching ratio (in chain) array
        Returns:
        the result

      • bateman

        public static void bateman(int n,
                           double[] dcst,
                           double[] pdcst,
                           double[] n0,
                           double[] s)
        Compute chain activities using Bateman decay law.
        Parameters:
        n, - numbers of nuclides in chain.
        dcst, - decay constant array for those nuclides
        pdcst, - partial decay constant array for those nuclides
        n0, - initial number of atoms for those nuclides. Common scenario, only parent nuclide is present at initial time.
        s, - additional sources term which contributes by injecting nuclides in chain. Common scenario, no external sources (zero array) just natural decay.

      • gammaAbsorbedDoseDebit

        public static double gammaAbsorbedDoseDebit(double photonEnergy,
                                            double yield,
                                            double sourceActivity,
                                            double calculationPointDistance,
                                            double massEnergyAbsCoeff)
        Given photon energy in MeV, its yield (probability of emission) as a number less or equal to 1, the source activity in Bq which emits those photons, the mass-energy absorbtion coefficient in cm^2/g taken from literature (or by other means) and the distance from the radioactive source in cm, this routine returns the dose debit due to absorbtion of gamma radiation at that distance in microGy/hour.
        Parameters:
        photonEnergy - photonEnergy
        yield - yield
        sourceActivity - sourceActivity
        calculationPointDistance - calculationPointDistance
        massEnergyAbsCoeff - massEnergyAbsCoeff
        Returns:
        the result

      • gammaAbsorbedDose

        public static double gammaAbsorbedDose(double photonEnergy,
                                       double yield,
                                       double sourceActivity,
                                       double calculationPointDistance,
                                       double massEnergyAbsCoeff,
                                       double exposureTime)
        Given photon energy in MeV, its yield (probability of emission) as a number less or equal to 1, the source activity in Bq which emits those photons, the mass-energy absorbtion coefficient in cm^2/g taken from literature (or by other means), the distance from the radioactive source in cm and the exposure time in seconds at that location, this routine returns the dose due to absorbtion of gamma radiation at that distance in microGy.
        Parameters:
        photonEnergy - photonEnergy
        yield - yield
        sourceActivity - sourceActivity
        calculationPointDistance - calculationPointDistance
        massEnergyAbsCoeff - massEnergyAbsCoeff
        exposureTime - exposureTime
        Returns:
        the result

        Compute the maximum mass-path length of electrons (beta radiation) in g/cm^2 for given energy (MeV). Semi-empirical formulae is used.
        Parameters:
        maxBetaEnergy - maxBetaEnergy
        Returns:
        the result

      • betaBremsRadDose

        @Deprecated
public static double betaBremsRadDose(double yield,
                                                   double betaMaxEnergy,
                                                   int mediumIndex,
                                                   double calcPointDistance,
                                                   double gammaMassEnergyAbsCoeff,
                                                   double gammaLinAttCoeff,
                                                   double volActivity,
                                                   double exposureTime)
        Deprecated. 

      • gammaRadDose

        public static double gammaRadDose(double yield,
                                  double gammaEnergy,
                                  double calcPointDistance,
                                  double gammaMassEnergyAbsCoeff,
                                  double gammaLinAttCoeff,
                                  double volActivity,
                                  double exposureTime)
        Compute dose at a target point P surrounded by a radioactive medium. Common ussage is to consider a soft tissue medium (simulates the human body) at P and surrounded by air or water (air or water submersion). The radiation fluence proportional with the number of photons reaching the target coming from volume dV at r distance from target is: dPHI = yield*[volActivity/(4*PI*r*r)]*dV*exposureTime*EXP(-LinAttMedium*r). Dose at target is dD = dPHI * gammaEnergy * gammaMassEnergyAbsCoeff. The infinitesimal volume dV=r*r*sin(theta)*dr*dtheta*dphi; r in range 0,MaxValue; theta in range 0,PI; phi in range 0,2*PI Integration is performed analytically here considering all radiations coming from within a sphere of radius MaxValue reach the target.
        Parameters:
        yield - yield
        gammaEnergy - gammaEnergy in MeV
        calcPointDistance - is MaxValue considered in integration in cm
        gammaMassEnergyAbsCoeff - gammaMassEnergyAbsCoeff in cm^2/g for target (e.g. soft tissue)
        gammaLinAttCoeff - gammaLinAttCoeff for surrounding media in cm^-1 (e.g. air)
        volActivity - volActivity in Bq/cm^3
        exposureTime - exposureTime in seconds
        Returns:
        the absorbed dose in target in mGy

      • xTubeAirKermaAtExit

        public static double xTubeAirKermaAtExit(double voltage,
                                         double zAnode,
                                         double mA,
                                         double exposureTime,
                                         double gammaMassAbsAirCoeff,
                                         double filtration,
                                         double absorbantDist)
        Given an XRay tube voltage in kV, current in mA, Z for anode, exposure time in seconds, mass-energy absorbtion coefficient in air (cm^2/g) at average photon energy in spectrum, the tube total filtration in mmAl and the distance in cm, this routine returns the kerma in air at that distance in microGy. Average photon enery ~ (2/3)voltage/1000.
        Parameters:
        voltage - voltage
        zAnode - zAnode
        mA - mA
        exposureTime - exposureTime
        gammaMassAbsAirCoeff - gammaMassAbsAirCoeff
        filtration - filtration
        absorbantDist - absorbantDist
        Returns:
        the result

      • computeDeadTime

        public static double computeDeadTime(double r12,
                                     double Ro1,
                                     double Ro2)
        Compute dead time based on two sources having known activities quotient!
        Parameters:
        r12 - the fraction A1/A2 (or real counts rate quotient R1/R2)
        Ro1 - the observed (measured) counts rate for source 1 (counts per second)
        Ro2 - the observed (measured) counts rate for source 2 (counts per second)
        Returns:
        the detection dead time in seconds

      • computeDeadTime2

        public static double computeDeadTime2(double r12,
                                      double r1,
                                      double r2)
        Compute dead time based on two sources having unknown activities quotient! Requires a sensitive measurements geometry: First measure source 1 and record its observed counts rate r1. Then insert a second source and record counts rate r12. Finally remove source 1 and record counts rate r2. Note: the measurement geometry must be the same!! Alternatives : Construct 3 sources in same geometry !!! First two sources as above and the third being equivalent with the sum of first two sources!!
        Parameters:
        r12 - the observed (measured) counts rate for source1+source2 (counts per second)
        r1 - the observed (measured) counts rate for source 1 (counts per second)
        r2 - the observed (measured) counts rate for source 2 (counts per second)
        Returns:
        the detection dead time in seconds

                                    double tmort)

        Parameters:

        tmort - the dead time in seconds.
        Returns:
        the result

        public static double tmortCorOfImp(double x,
                                   double t,
                                   double tmort)
        Compute the counts corrected by dead time.
        Parameters:
        x - the counts
        t - time taken to measure the counts in seconds
        tmort - dead time in seconds
        Returns:
        the result

      • minRateOfDec

        public static double minRateOfDec(double F,
                                  int Nf,
                                  double tf,
                                  int Nq,
                                  double tq)
        Compute the minimum detectable count rate in counts per second.
        Parameters:
        F - average count rate for background in counts per second
        Nf - number of successive measurements for background
        tf - time for each background measurement in seconds
        Nq - number of successive measurements for sample
        tq - time for each sample measurement in seconds
        Returns:
        the result

      • minRateOfDecError

        public static double minRateOfDecError(double F,
                                       int Nf,
                                       double tf,
                                       int Nq,
                                       double tq)
        The formal uncertainty associated with the minimum detectable count rate in counts per second.
        Parameters:
        F - average count rate for background in counts per second
        Nf - number of successive measurements for background
        tf - time for each background measurement in seconds
        Nq - number of successive measurements for sample
        tq - time for each sample measurement in seconds
        Returns:
        the result
